nodes.text: "Sunny Side of Ryloth" was a song by the band Red Shift Limit. The song title referenced the planet Ryloth, the homeworld of the Twi'lek species. The composition was included on the band's compilation album Thoughts from the Core, available in the galaxy by the time between the years 0 ABY and 4 ABY. Red Shift Limit was deemed to be an anti-Imperial band by the Imperial Board of Culture, who banned the track.
"Sunny Side of Ryloth" was mentioned in Galaxy Guide 9: Fragments from the Rim, a 1993 reference book for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game, written by Simon Smith and Eric Trautmann.

According to early portrayals in the Star Wars Legends continuity, Ryloth was a tide-locked planet, a phenomenon that resulted in one side of the planet always facing the sun, therefore being the "sunny side." However, this information has since been overridden by more recent sources.
